item.title: Many of Heavy rubbish trolley laying on the spot light damages the spot, 27th June
item.description:
The spot light foundation cement base is broken because of CO OP staff misusing the pavement foot way and the spot light. That makes the street and the foot way unsafe and causing risks for the pedestrians. Furthermore, the spot is about to break down because of the amount of heavy trolley on it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Berwick Street, City of Westminster
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping by the same resident again., 27th June
item.description:
These items were fly tipped between 1.30 and 2.30pm on 27th June by the occupant who lives overlooking the communal rubbish bins.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Arthur Grove, Plumstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Parking incompetence, 27th June
item.description:
Here we go, another stupid small car parking like he owns the street not respecting the parking lines so the next car can’t park properly as it doesn’t fit. It is already difficult to find a parking slot and here we are dealing with people who don’t have any empathy for the others. Keep going!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Montrell Road, Streatham Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road bump, 27th June
item.description:
The crossings at waterloo station has a bump in the road which is very dangerous. If your running you will get seriously injured. Its scary. There was a bike incident around today 12noon I think due to the bump. I didnt manage to take any photo but can do maybe tomorrow if needed. Please can you get it fixed. People dont notice it and they end up tripping. I witnessed it happen to 2 or 3 ppl today.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): The Balcony, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet
